title: Towel, late 19th–early 20th century
medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk on cotton
Technique: counted and uncounted stitches; double running and overcasting stitches on plain weave; overcasting stitches create deflected element work; bobbin lace
description: Towel with a five and half inch embroidered border at each end. The borders, which are identical, have six repeats of a two inch wide flower, the blossom alternately pink and blue. The one inch high lower border extends five inches up each side. The design is in pink, blue and green with metallic silver and gold accents. Each end of the towel is trimmed with gold metallic bobbin lace which is sewn across the bottom and five and a half inches up each side.

tombstone.epitaph:
Towel, late 19th–early 20th century.Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk on cotton
Technique: counted and uncounted stitches; double running and overcasting stitches on plain weave; overcasting stitches create deflected element work; bobbin lace. 1974-76-4.
